item.title: communicating sequential processes
item.description: This is an unfinished review of the book Communicating Sequential Processes by C. A. R. Hoare. I’d like to quote Dijkstra on how enlightening this book is. The most profound reason, however, was keenly felt by those who had seen earlier drafts of his manuscript, which shed with surprising clarity new light on what computing science could—or even should—be. To say or feel that the computing scientist’s main challenge is not to get confused by the complexities of his own making is one thing; it is quite a different matter to discover and show how a strict adherence to the tangible and quite explicit elegance of a few mathematical laws can achieve this lofty goal.
